The site also covers major technology, science, health, and entertainment news from both external and in-house sources and provides software and game reviews. {{As of|December 2008}}, it is one of the top 500 websites according to [[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] [[web traffic|traffic]] rankings,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/softpedia.com |title=SoftPedia.com |accessdate=2010-09-21 |year=2010 |work=[[Alexa Internet|Alexa]]}}</ref> and the 10th most visited site by Romanians.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.alexa.com/topsites/countries/RO |accessdate=2009-12-25 |year=2009 |work=[[Alexa Internet|Alexa]] |title=Top Sites in Romania}}</ref><ref name=owner/> Like [[Download.com]], it is a "popular destination for software downloads".<ref>{{citation |title=Enhancements in query evaluation and page summarization of The Thinking Algorithm |work=International Symposium on Information Technology, 2008. |year=2008 |author1=Jameel, M.S.|author2=Akshat, A. |author3=Singh, C.T. |doi=10.1109/ITSIM.2008.4632050 |isbn=978-1-4244-2327-9 |pages=1â8 }}</ref>
Software categories are arranged hierarchically and are modeled after Windows filesystem paths, such as "C: \ Mobile Phone Tools \ Sony Ericsson". Users can sort by criteria such as the date of the last update, the number of downloads, or the rating. There are three viewing modes, normal, [[freeware]], or [[shareware]], allowing users to screen out certain types of software.<ref>{{Citation |last=Kraynak |first=Joe |title=Que's Official Internet Yellow Pages, 2006 Edition |date=2005-08-29 |publisher=Que Publishing |location= |isbn=0-7897-3408-7 |pages=202}}</ref>
It is owned by company Softnews Net, from [[Romania]].<ref name=owner>{{citation |title= Many website owners see major revenue and profit declines |work= [[Ziarul Financiar]] |date= 20 Jul 2010 |url= http://www.zf.ro/zf-english/many-website-owners-see-major-revenue-and-profit-declines-6640917 |quote= Softnews Net, the company behind softpedia.com website - one of the most visited websites in Romania, is one of the few players on the Romanian online market to have recorded a rise in revenues and profit last year, according to Trade Registry data.}}</ref> Although it is of Romanian ownership, the website is oriented to English speakers.<ref name=owner2>{{citation |title= Ce afaceri au rulat greii din online-ul romanesc in 2009 (What business heavyweights have run the online site in 2009 Romanian) |work= wall-street.ro |date= 22 July 2010 |language= Romanian |url= http://www.wall-street.ro/slideshow/Marketing-PR/89710/Ce-afaceri-au-rulat-greii-din-online-ul-romanesc-in-2009/3/Jucatorii-din-servicii-afaceri-in-scadere.html#slide_title |quote= Softnews Net, which launched in 2001 the site softpedia.com (...) Most of company revenues come from online advertising but on the www.softpedia.com, addressed to English speakers.
